content:
Can you fix these errors without changing the structure of the memo'ization? It took a lot of work to get the page performant.

$ npx eslint . --ext .js,.jsx,.ts,.tsx
=============

WARNING: You are currently running a version of TypeScript which is not officially supported by @typescript-eslint/typescript-estree.

You may find that it works just fine, or you may not.

SUPPORTED TYPESCRIPT VERSIONS: >=4.7.4 <5.5.0

YOUR TYPESCRIPT VERSION: 5.5.3

Please only submit bug reports when using the officially supported version.

=============

/Users/dgish/code-git/superhero-ai/superhero-nextjs/src/components/FormattedMessage.tsx
   49:45  error  Component definition is missing display name                                                                                    react/display-name
  113:38  error  React Hook "useMemo" is called conditionally. React Hooks must be called in the exact same order in every component render      react-hooks/rules-of-hooks
  247:35  error  React Hook "useCallback" is called conditionally. React Hooks must be called in the exact same order in every component render  react-hooks/rules-of-hooks
  253:5   error  React Hook "useEffect" is called conditionally. React Hooks must be called in the exact same order in every component render    react-hooks/rules-of-hooks
  459:12  error  Component definition is missing display name                                                                                    react/display-name
Nope, that slowed down the app dramatically. Analyze why it ran well previously and why your changes slowed it down.

Still getting these errors. Knowing everything you know now, how can you fix them without affecting memo performance?

/Users/dgish/code-git/superhero-ai/superhero-nextjs/src/components/FormattedMessage.tsx
  113:38  error  React Hook "useMemo" is called conditionally. React Hooks must be called in the exact same order in every component render      react-hooks/rules-of-hooks
  247:35  error  React Hook "useCallback" is called conditionally. React Hooks must be called in the exact same order in every component render  react-hooks/rules-of-hooks
  253:5   error  React Hook "useEffect" is called conditionally. React Hooks must be called in the exact same order in every component render    react-hooks/rules-of-hooks
  459:12  error  Component definition is missing display name                                                                                    react/display-name

Nope, that failed. The project gets very slow. 

List a couple hypothesis of why and then add in log messages to help figure it out.
